STARTING TODAY: Support our students by giving to the Faith Family Education Foundation through North Texas Giving Day!

The Foundation supports Faith Family Academy students by funding a number of initiatives, including $50,000 in scholarships awarded to eight Class of 2020 graduates.

Early giving starts today! Plus, donations of $25 and above are eligible for bonus funds from the Communities Foundation of Texas!

Give today --- >> https://buff.ly/32HWQqX

post_text: Faith Family Academy of Oak Cliff students, teachers and staff and our Foundation celebrated Black History Month with an event honoring the contributions of African-Americans to American life, history and culture. World War II hero Dorie L. Miller was honored. The United States Navy recently announced its next aircraft carrier will be named after Dorie L. Miller, marking the first time that an aircraft carrier will be named after an enlisted serviceman. In the past, such an honor has been reserved for U.S. Presidents.
text: Faith Family Academy of Oak Cliff students, teachers and staff and our Foundation celebrated Black History Month with an event honoring the contributions of African-Americans to American life, history and culture. World War II hero Dorie L. Miller was honored. The United States Navy recently announced its next aircraft carrier will be named after Dorie L. Miller, marking the first time that an aircraft carrier will be named after an enlisted serviceman. In the past, such an honor has been reserved for U.S. Presidents.

post_text:
Our Elementary students rocked the first Makerspace challenge of the year! ðŸ˜

Their mission: move a ball precisely from point A to point B by setting up a circuit using Little Bits. Little Bits are color-coded circuits equipment that allow students to students to create, invent, tinker, and explore hands-on learning activities and engage in circuit building, coding, 3D printing, and other 21st-century STEM design & engineering activities.

ðŸ’™ðŸ’›ðŸ’™ðŸ’›

This is the first Makerspace project using new equipment provided by a grant from the Dart Foundation. Last year, The Dart Foundation awarded Faith Family Academy a $5,000 grant to purchase additional equipment for our Makerspace.

The new Little Bits Pro Library provided by The Dart Foundation grant is a giant collection of the latest Little Bits and accessories, designed so students can build thousands of inventions. Over 5,000 projects include basic and complex STEM hands-on inventions and coding projects.

Thank you Dart Foundation!

The Moody Foundation has awarded Faith Family Academy - Waxahachie a $92,159 grant for the design and installation of a new playground at our campus!

This is a huge step towards our goal of raising $150,000 to provide an engaging, interactive play environment for all of our students. Thank you Moody Foundation!

post_text:
**Scholarship Spotlight**

Faith Family Education Foundation Scholarships provide financial assistance to Faith Family Academy high school graduating seniors interested in or intending to pursue a post-high school course of study at a college, university, or other post-secondary educational institution.

Recipients of this scholarship have demonstrated strong community involvement and have made a positive difference in their community, school, and families.

The Class of 2019 Faith Family Education Foundation Scholarship recipients are:

Oliver Aramburo - Texas Woman's University
Davon Mata - Texas Woman's University
Cesar Saldana - Brookhaven College
Mytoya Sneed - Texas Woman's University
Emily Cruz - The University of Texas at Arlington

post_text: It's almost time to head back to school! Our first day of school is August 19.
text: It's almost time to head back to school! Our first day of school is August 19.

post_text:
The Foundation is honored and proud to support Faith Family Academy students with scholarships to help them further their education after high school. Over the next few weeks, we will highlight Foundation scholarship recipients from the Class of 2019.

***

The Trey Henry Phillips Memorial Scholarship provides financial assistance to Faith Family Academy high school graduating seniors interested in or intending to pursue a post-high school course of study at a technical or trade school. Recipients of this scholarship have demonstrated strong community involvement and have made a positive difference in their community, school, and families.

This year's recipients of the Trey Henry Phillips Memorial Scholarship are Daisy Venzes and Mariah Flores. Daisy will attend El Centro College and Mariah will attend PCI Health Training Center.
